main event: On August 20, 1951, an unconventional aircraft was observed in Spokane, Washington. The object was elliptical in shape, silver or aluminum in color, and approximately 30-60 feet in diameter. It was observed for 2-3 minutes and appeared to be stationary in the air at times.
interesting points: The object did not make any noise and had no trail or exhaust.
Observers estimated the speed of the object to be 500-600 miles per hour when it was sighted at approximately 40 degrees.
The object started an 80-90 degree climb and continued until it disappeared from view.
The observation lasted for 2-3 minutes, and no aircraft were seen in the vicinity at the time.
The witnesses, who had no significant knowledge of aircraft, claimed that the weather conditions or specific situation over the area could likely not have induced the observed phenomenon.
witnesses: observers with no significant knowledge of aircraft
